    2017-08-04

    • Constructor Detail

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String filename,
             boolean visible)
        This constructor creates a new Image object based on an existing file. The file format must be JPG, PNG, BMP or GIF. The title of the image is taken from the filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - File to be loaded.
        visible - Whether or not to display the Image using Java AWT.

      • Image

        public Image​(java.lang.String file)

      • Image

        public Image​(int width,
             int height,
             java.lang.String title,
             boolean visible)
        This onstructor creates a new black image.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of image.
        height - Height of image.
        title - Title of image.
        visible - Whether or not to display the Image using Java AWT.

      • Image

        public Image​(int width,
             int height,
             java.lang.String title)
        This onstructor creates a new black image.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of image.
        height - Height of image.
        title - Title of image.

      • Image

        public Image​(Image image)
        This constructor creates a copy of another Image object. Copies all pixels as well.
        Parameters:
        image - Image object to copy.
        visible - Whether or not to display the Image using Java AWT.

        public void setTitle​(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of the image.
        Parameters:
        title - New title.

      • getPixel

        public Pixel getPixel​(int i,
                      int j)
        Returns the pixel in position (i,j). If the position is outside the image, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        i - Horizontal index.
        j - Vertical index.

      • getPixels

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pixel> getPixels()
        Returns an arraylist with all the pixels in the image.
        Returns:
        ArrayList with all pixels in image.

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.ArrayList<Pixel> getNeighbours​(int i,
                                                int j)
        Returns an arraylist with the (up to nine) direct neighbours of the pixel in position (i,j). Pixel (i,j) is also included.
        Parameters:
        i - Horizontal index.
        j - Vertical index.

      • updateCanvas

        public void updateCanvas()
        Informs the image that one or more of its pixels has changed value, and that it is time to repaint the canvas.

      • close

        protected void close()
        Closes this Image, if showing
